Sentencas: The BaCe0 center dot 4Zr0 center dot 4Y0 center dot 2O3 (BCZY) was modified with the NiO sintering aid and prepared by a microwave sintering (MVS) method as the electrolyte for proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells (H-SOFCs).
Titulo: Microwave sintering coupled with sintering aids for proton-conducting oxide membranes

Sentencas: The incorporation of NiO into the BCZY lattice improves the sinterability of the material, leading to the increase of the shrinkage from 3% to 26% after the high-temperature sintering.
Titulo: Microwave sintering coupled with sintering aids for proton-conducting oxide membranes

Sentencas: The dense BaCe0 center dot 4Zr0 center dot 4Y0 center dot 15Ni0 center dot 05O3 (BCZYN) pellet can be obtained after sintering at 1500.
Titulo: Microwave sintering coupled with sintering aids for proton-conducting oxide membranes

Sentencas: C, whereas the Ni-free BCZY is porous after sintering at the same condition.
Titulo: Microwave sintering coupled with sintering aids for proton-conducting oxide membranes

Sentencas: By further using the MVS method, the BCZYN can be densified at 1300 degrees C, which is 200 degrees C lower than conventional sintering.
Titulo: Microwave sintering coupled with sintering aids for proton-conducting oxide membranes

Sentencas: Furthermore, the microwave-sintered BCZYN has a higher conductivity than the conventionally sintered one due to the larger grain size.
Titulo: Microwave sintering coupled with sintering aids for proton-conducting oxide membranes

Sentencas: Using the MVS method in the H-SOFCs fabrication, the high porosity of the anode substrate can be retained.
Titulo: Microwave sintering coupled with sintering aids for proton-conducting oxide membranes

Sentencas: In contrast, the cell prepared by the conventional sintering (CS) method has a relatively dense anode, which is detrimental to gas fuel transportation.
Titulo: Microwave sintering coupled with sintering aids for proton-conducting oxide membranes

Sentencas: As a result, the microwave sintered cell exhibits an output of 1010 mW cm 2 at 700 degrees C, which is significantly larger than that for the conventionally sintered cell, being 535 mW cm(-2) at the same testing condition, suggesting the advantage of using the MVS method for the fuel cell fabrication.
Titulo: Microwave sintering coupled with sintering aids for proton-conducting oxide membranes
